text: The quality of the meat is definitely top-tier among Korean restaurants in Singapore! The price is well worth it for the meat quality, and the sauces are tasty too — not the overly strong flavors you usually find at typical Korean BBQ buffets. The unlimited refillable side dishes are a big plus, and there’s even a complimentary vegetable platter.

The shellfish are so good! Fresh and sweet!
The Korean grilled pork belly is yums too!

Updated review in Jun to reflect the new menu:Must try the grilled squid! If you ask nicely you could also try off menu items e.g. 面疙瘩 (tomato egg soup base)
Reasonable price and taste good. The chef is the boss. Very friendly. About $30 for the pork belly, clams, half pork trotter 猪手. The pork belly not very oily and the trotter very tender.

This stall at the new Jurong West hawker centre sells Mainland Chinese cuisine. I tried the signature 水煮肉 and opted for chicken which cost $5, and added a bowl of rice for $1. They were very generous with the vegetables and there was a decent amount of chicken. Taste-wise, the dish was on the milder side, probably to cater to the Singaporean palate. It took quite a while to prepare the dish but I think the wait was well worth it!

The chef has an amazing & kind attitude, spent a lot of time explaining in both English & Mandarin what's the most authentic combo.. and even demonstrated us how to properly compose our wraps & eat them! Highly recommend.
